newsitem.title: UK: BBC dominates UK TV viewing in 12 mths ended March.
newsitem.headline: BBC dominates UK TV viewing in 12 mths ended March.

text.p: The BBC continues to dominate television viewing in Britain, although its share of the viewing audience fell slightly in the 12 months ended March 31, Britain's television watchdog reported on Thursday.

The Independent Television Commission (ITC) said the BBC's total audience share was 43.9 percent in the 12 months to March 31, including a 32.2 percent share for its flagship station BBC1. BBC2, which caters to a niche audience, won 11.7 percent, the ITC reported.
In the 12 months ended December 31, 1996, the BBC had a total share of 44 percent, including a 32.5 percent share for BBC1 and an 11.5 percent share for BBC2.
ITV, the mass market, commercial Independent Television Network which includes multiple regional licensees as well as GMTV, won a 34.6 percent audience share in the period, the ITC said.
ITV in the 12 months ended December 1996 had claimed an audience share of 35 percent.
Channel 4's share rose slightly to 10.3 percent from 10.2 percent in the 12 months ended December, the ITC said.
Channel 5, Britain's fifth terrestrial television station which launched on March 30, was not included in the results.
